name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: I will continue pushing for commonsense gun safety legislation so we can  #EndGunViolence and save lives and I applaud the Biden-Harris @WhiteHouse for announcing strong initial executive actions to address the gun violence public health crisis. https://t.co/HsZfCMucSJ

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: We know all too well the dangers of rampant circulation of assault-style firearms in America, where our people are 25 times more likely to die from gun violence than people in other developed countries.

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: The NFA Modernization Act would enact a long overdue yet modest increase of the tax from $200 to $300 and tie the increase to inflation starting in 2022. The additional revenue would fund federal gun violence prevention programs. https://t.co/KdG0CfUupW

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: The National Firearms Act was enacted in 1934 to deter the circulation of firearms that were used to commit crimes by imposing a $200 tax on the transfer of these weapons. A tax of $200 in 1934 would equal a tax of $3,925 in 2021. https://t.co/6RJcDcA1Co

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: The National Firearms Act (NFA) Modernization Act would modestly increase the tax paid to transfer weapons regulated by the NFA‚Äîincluding machine guns, short-barreled rifles and shotguns, and silencers‚Äîand funnel the additional revenue to federal #gunviolenceprevention programs.

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: The SAFER Act would make it a federal offense to return firearms to the person from whom they have been confiscated, acting as a greater deterrent than the existing patchwork of state transfer laws. https://t.co/VBsiLSitL2

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: It‚Äôs troubling that there‚Äôs no federal law banning the return of guns to people who have had their gun licenses revoked or their guns removed by court order. We saw the deadly cost of this regulatory loophole in the 2018 Nashville Waffle House shooting: https://t.co/HnLZew7nrB

name: Rep. Jamie Raskin
tweet_text: Today I proudly introduced two bills to deter the transfer of guns to dangerous individuals, deter the transfer of assault-style weapons, and increase funding for federal gun violence prevention programs: https://t.co/eqGnGnBLSU

tweet_text: Our bill addresses these problems by creating a national framework that will allow board members to operate w/o the threat of personal liability while still ensuring that the boards are responsive to state gov‚Äôt oversight, professional standards & the wellbeing of the public.
